newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ESTONIA-HANSAINVEST SEES MORTGAGE FINANCE AGENCY BY AUG.
newsitem.headline: ESTONIA-HANSAINVEST SEES MORTGAGE FINANCE AGENCY BY AUG.

text.p: Estonia's Hansa Investments said on Friday that it expected to make a final decision on setting up a mortgage finance agency in Estonia on March 26.
Chairman Joakim Helenius said if the final business plan was approved at a meeting on March 26 then registration could be completed by June and the agency could be operational by August.
"This will be the first such agency in all of central and eastern Europe," Helenius told Reuters in an interview.
He said the agency, regulated by the central bank, will be an independently capitalised, single purpose agency.
"It will stand ready to buy mortgages from the banking sector. It is very difficult for the banks themselves to securitise their mortgages," Helenius said.
"This agency will be able to totally take over the ownership and legal responsibility of their mortgages thereby freeing up the balance sheets of the banks.
"By operating as a central agency it will able to accumulate large enough volumes to securitise them and issue securities backed up by these mortgage.
"These will become the largest by far Estonian originated securities."
Helenius said there was already strong interest.
"We have very strong interest from international investors because of the margins we will able to provide and they will probably also be of interest to Estonian clients," Helenius said.
